Rosario + Vampire is a story following Tsukune Aono and his adventures of every day life in youkai academy. With each new episode a new story is started, with the exception of his expanding harem and major plot points. This turns some people way but it lends to more story over all. The anime is similar to the manga but is also very different. With light ecchi spread out leading to very fun dialog. You should go in expecting a comedy more than any thing. To this date it is my 3rd favorite anime and I have watched it at leas four or five times.

Rosario to Vampire is an anime centered on tsukune aono. The plot is good but I personally the manga is better.
Overall I think that the ecchi scenes are too much and the annoying bat covers them. Believe me manga is WAY better.

Rosario + Vampire...
I have to say, I'm normally not a fan of harem anime types, but I actually enjoyed this one quite a bit. I found it very fun to watch and had a lot of fun watching Tsukune's adventures with the girls :). 
As it is a harem anime with ecchi written all over it with crazy fan-service, I feel that it actually has a pretty decent story behind it. I found there is some good character development (namely with Inner Moka, Kurumu and Tsukune) and it also has it's deep moments too. I really like how the character Tsukune seems to be moreinvolved wth the other characters than typically known in harem anime and is not often shoved to the side like most. This very fact is one of the bigger reasons I enjoyed it more and overall, I give this anime an 8/10 for having some decent character development, serious moments and being very enjoyable, despite it's large amounts of fan-service. \n\n
If you don't mind silly mountains of fan-service, than this might be a good watch :).

By the way, I'm still watching this anime.. this review I made is more on my experience while I'm watching it..
Fifteen-year-old Tsukune Aono is average in every way; he has no hobbies, less-than-stellar grades and he's even flunked his high school entrance exam. His parents have managed to enroll him in a school, but it's no ordinary school! Tsukune will be attending the Youkai Academy, a place where monsters learn how to co-exist with humans! As the werewolves, vampires, witches and other monsters are required to retain their human forms, Tsukune - the lone human - is able to avoid their bloodthirsty gazes. However, hequickly attracts the attention of a number of devilish beauties including the vampire Moka, a busty succubus and even a young witch! It seems Tsukune's average life isn't so average anymore!\n

A fair harem story. But it's too typical. Based on monsters, magic, high school, and harem -- you know what it's going to be. Even so, there's a good enjoyment in this anime.
The characters aren't all too great. I still can't figure out a lot of things like why do they have those rules in the school that no one can tell somebody else what's their true form. The jealousy thing is a bit too serious in this anime.
Some shortcomings of the story:
-Where on Earth is this thing situated?
-The school seems pretty small but as the story proceeds, it kind of fleshes out in thenumber of students and classes. This seems pretty weird.\n
-Come on, there's no patrolling or security outside campus considering this whole area belongs to monsters? Students can practically go a bit farther than school, transform into their monster states, and freaking kill each other and no one says anything. How absurd.\n\n
One thing that made the story stand out was that it's not an intense story even if it's filled with superpowers and monsters. In other words, no one actually dies. Even enemies become friends later on. So it's a pretty okay-ish story. Things get better from the next season so it's not too bad to watch it.

Reminds me of Princess Resurrection in more ways than one. The basic similarities are that they were both better as manga, and the main male character was a weakling pushover in both the manga and the anime; but had some real power in the manga. IE: some kind of transformation. Which were cool but left out of the anime’s for some reason. I guess so they wouldn't be so cool or to give the main character a since of still being human in a world that is far from.  
The show seems in a rush to cover as much of the first 5 volumesas possbile and compress that into 13 epi all the while leaving out the elements that helped build up and make the story as interesting as it was. With season 2 coming out there is little sign that this highly compressed half baked setup will be changed.

While it may not be as good as the manga and while it may be a cluster of fanservice it was still highly enjoyable. The comedy was spot-on 95% of the time. It's satiric purpose which many who have watched don't understand is astounding. The reason many people say it is essentially the same thing over and over is because it is. Funny situtation leads to main guy confusing or hurting a girl, girl runs off, guy gets in trouble, girl comes back and miraculously saves him. This is a ircet pardy of the majority of these romance/action animes.

Rosario vampire. This is basically the monster girl quest of anime. The main character is trying so hard not to get laid while a bunch of monster girls want to sleep with him.
The bad. It seemed like it was going for the monster of the week approach by in a more adult series. As childish as some of the jokes are, it is still meant for older teens to adults. So this monster of the week scenario isn't really all that good of an idea. It would have benefited from having arcs dedicated to a different monster rather than having a monster of the week,because we don't get the want for these villains to go down. The villains are another thing I don't like about the series, they all seem too forced, with the exception or Ruby, who has a legitimate reason for attacking and killing human beings. The series doesn't take itself as seriously as it should at most points. At some points it does, but those parts aren't serious enough to warrant almost a whole season of comic relief.


The good. Where as it doesn't work as a whole, the monster of the week scenario does add a lot of humor to the series, making it forgivable. The comedy is something that this series does very well, whether it is situation comedy or a play on words within the series, they handle the comedy very well. But when it comes to being serious, and having a serious scene between two characters, they can pull it off well. I did really enjoy the art style of this show and felt that it fit with the feel of the series. And the ending was a really good.


Final Verdict:

It's good. I really enjoyed it and I would suggest giving it a try.


7/10

Rosario+Vampire is sooooo stupid, why would I want to watch an harem anime that's so stupid? Because it's fun! This is so stupid that it's fun I actually found myself laughing with this anime a lot just as I did with Highschool DXD, but just because it's fun does that make it good? Well, let's take a look. 
The plot centers around a human named Tsukune who accidently gets enrolled into a school named Youkai Academy, a school that's purely inhabited by monsters and meets a beautiful vampire named Moka who wears a rosary. He also comes across a few other monster girls that heends up befriending and each of them wanting a piece of him. Kurumu the Succubus, Yukari the Witch, and Mizore the Yuki-Oona, (Ice Woman). 


It's basically just a typical harem story of more then one woman wanting the same guy cause they either find him attractive or they love his personality and want to be his girlfriend and eventually; marry him but what keeps it entertaining is the comedy. The comedy is just freaking hilarious and yes there are times that it can get a little annoying but the comedy keeps it going. It's also got some great fighting sequences in it though it does get a little boring cause it only lasts like 1-3 minutes, but it's still good. The anime while probably could had been a little better I will say is pretty good. Hell, I really love the fact that they made Moka a very colorful vampire and I don't say that often for vampires because we're typically used to seeing the goth like version of a vampire which is usually what they are, but here it's just a nice change of pace really. 


The music unfortunatly didn't really do it for me here. It wasn't entertaining or anything nor was it that good, with the exception of one thing, the ending theme. The ending theme was actually pretty good and I loved the scenery that they used for it. I also loved that it started out slow and then got really going with this fast pace, rock theme to it. 


Despite the characters acting the same in every episode, with them trying to win Tsukune over by either seducing him, sucking his blood, or freezing him, etc. The characters were honestly not that bad, they had their own personality, their own reasons for wanting to have Tsukune to themselves, Mizore in perticular, and I liked the fact that they were all of a different race. Hell, I really enjoyed Mizore a lot. I loved her story arc, I loved her design, and I actually loved the fact that she was the only monster outside the school who knew about Tsukune before she came into the picture. 


Like I said, while this anime is undeniably stupid, it is honestly a ton of fun to watch, because it was the comedy that really kept it going. Though I will say that even though we did get a second season that was also only of 13 episodes, I honestly wish we had gotten more because I think they could had made it a little better if they had more episodes to it.

If you enjoy comedy and ecchi and you'll be sure to love Rosario + Vampire! First off, my friends tried to make me watch this and I did. This show is FILLED with fanservice and it deeply annoys me!
The thing that suprised me is the story. It's really creative which is something I enjoy and I somehow enjoyed the art.
Overall, like I said before, if you really like ecchi... you'll love this anime.
